roleInLitigation.summary: Legal Authorities define WHERE cases are heard. They represent the judicial and quasi-judicial bodies that adjudicate disputes - from Assessment Officers to the Supreme Court.

lifecycle.role: Authority determines jurisdiction and applicable procedural rules
lifecycle.impact: Wrong authority = wrong statutory deadlines and forum

lifecycle.role: Provides venue information, bench locations, and judicial roster
lifecycle.impact: Missing authority data = no hearing location, calendar failures

lifecycle.role: Authority level triggers specific statutory deadline rules
lifecycle.impact: Wrong authority level = miscalculated reply dates
Incorrect hierarchy = appeal filed at wrong forum

lifecycle.role: Cases grouped by jurisdiction for analytics

roleInLitigation.businessValue: Accurate authority data ensures cases are routed correctly, deadlines calculated properly, and hearings scheduled at valid venues.

systemDependencies.description: Legal Authorities are referenced by multiple downstream entities. Changes propagate immediately.

dependencies.usage: Determines case jurisdiction and forum for appeals
dependencies.impactOfBadData: Case shows wrong court, statutory deadlines miscalculated, reports grouped incorrectly

dependencies.usage: Provides hearing venue and location information
dependencies.impactOfBadData: Hearing scheduled at non-existent location, calendar invites have wrong address

dependencies.usage: Judges are assigned to specific courts
dependencies.impactOfBadData: Judges appear unlinked or at wrong court, hearing judge selection fails

dependencies.usage: Deadline rules vary by authority level (e.g., Tribunal has different limits than Assessing Officer)
dependencies.impactOfBadData: Wrong deadline rules applied, reply dates incorrect

dependencies.usage: Auto-populates bench locations for GST Tribunal entries
dependencies.impactOfBadData: Missing or incorrect GSTAT bench options

dataQualityRisks.cause: Same court imported from multiple sources or entered manually twice
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Cases split across duplicates, fragmented case history, inflated jurisdiction counts
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Run 'Check for duplicates' before import, search by code/name before creating
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Use Admin merge tool to consolidate, update case references

dataQualityRisks.cause: Incomplete form entry, skipped required field
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Statutory deadline rules cannot apply, case shows no appellate hierarchy
dataQualityRisks.prevention: authority_level is required field, validation blocks save without it
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Review all authorities with missing level, assign based on official classification

dataQualityRisks.cause: Registry phone/email changes, no periodic review
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Failed communications with court registry, missed notices
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Quarterly audit using 'Last Updated' filter, verify against court website
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Update contact info, add note with verification date

dataQualityRisks.cause: Manual entry error, misunderstanding of territorial jurisdiction
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Cases routed to wrong court, forum objections possible
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Validate against official court directory, cross-check with Bar Council data
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Correct jurisdiction, review affected cases for reassignment

dataQualityRisks.cause: Wrong state selected for Tribunal entry
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Hearing venue incorrect, travel planning failures
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Use GSTAT_STATE_BENCHES mapping, select state before bench
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Correct bench assignment, update hearing records

restrictions: Cannot delete authority with active cases (must reassign first)

responsibilities: Add new courts in practice areas they handle
Keep jurisdiction info current for their cases
Import seed data from official sources

initialSetup: Import from official court directory (GST Common Portal, Bar Council, eCourts)
Configure authority levels BEFORE adding individual courts
Set up GSTAT bench mappings for all operational states
Validate imported data against 2-3 known courts
dataEntry: Always search before creating to avoid duplicates
Fill ALL required fields including jurisdiction and authority level
Use official court code if available (e.g., GSTAT/MH/01)
Add contact info only from official sources (court website, registry)
maintenance: Deactivate closed courts, don't delete (preserves case history)
Update contact info when personnel change (registry officer rotation)
Review 'Last Updated' column monthly for stale entries
Document changes in notes field for audit trail
integration: Link judges AFTER creating authority (judge depends on court)
Verify GSTAT bench mapping before creating Tribunal cases
Test statutory deadline calculation after adding new authority level

authorityLevelHierarchy.description: Authority levels define the appellate hierarchy and applicable statutory rules

troubleshooting.issue: Judge dropdown empty when scheduling hearing
troubleshooting.cause: No judges linked to selected court
troubleshooting.solution: Add judges to Legal Authority first, ensure court_id matches

troubleshooting.cause: Authority level not set or no rule for this level
troubleshooting.solution: Verify authority_level is set, check statutory event types for matching rules

troubleshooting.cause: Authority type not set to 'Tribunal' or state not selected
troubleshooting.solution: Set authority type to Tribunal, select state first

troubleshooting.cause: Same court entered twice with different codes
troubleshooting.solution: Use Admin merge tool to consolidate, deduplicate cases

faqs.question: Can I delete a Legal Authority?
faqs.answer: Authorities with linked cases cannot be deleted. Mark as 'Inactive' instead to preserve case history while hiding from dropdowns.

faqs.question: How do I add a new GSTAT bench?
faqs.answer: Create a new Legal Authority with type 'Tribunal' and authority level 'TRIB'. Select the state to auto-populate bench options from GSTAT_STATE_BENCHES mapping.

faqs.question: What happens if I change authority level after cases are linked?
faqs.answer: Existing case deadlines are NOT recalculated. Only new cases use the updated level. Review affected cases manually.
